news.title: Top Experts
news.description: Real managers from real companies who have practically implemented contract management tools
news.fullContent:
Real managers from real companies who have practically implemented contract management tools. Our experts have years of experience working in leading corporations and are ready to share their knowledge with Narxoz Business School students.

Who are our experts?

At Narxoz Business School, we are proud that our programs are led by practicing specialists from leading companies in Kazakhstan and the world. These are not just theorists, but people who daily make important business decisions and manage large projects.

Practical experience

Our experts have experience working in companies such as:

  • KPMG Kazakhstan - international consulting company
  • Ernst & Young - one of the "Big Four" audit companies
  • Deloitte - leading consulting firm
  • PwC - PricewaterhouseCoopers, world leader in audit
  • Largest banks in Kazakhstan - practical experience in the financial sector
  • International corporations - global business experience

Innovative approaches

We constantly update our programs to meet modern business requirements. Our experts bring to education:

  • Real cases from practice - relevant examples from modern business
  • Modern management tools - latest technologies and methodologies
  • International experience - global trends and best practices
  • Networking opportunities - access to professional community

"The practical experience of our experts allows students to gain knowledge that can be immediately applied in real business."

Learning outcomes

Thanks to this approach, our graduates receive not only theoretical knowledge, but also practical skills that can be immediately applied in work. This is confirmed by the high positions of our graduates in leading companies in the region.
news.author: Narxoz Business School Team

news.title: Narxoz Business School entered the top 50 best business schools in Asia according to QS
news.description: The MBA program of Narxoz University Business School took 42nd place in the QS Global MBA 2025 Asia ranking and became #1 in the Central Asian region.
news.fullContent:
The MBA program of Narxoz University Business School took 42nd place in the QS Global MBA 2025 Asia ranking and became #1 in the Central Asian region. This is a historic achievement for Kazakhstani education and recognition of the high quality of our programs.

About QS Global MBA Rankings

QS Global MBA Rankings is one of the most authoritative business school rankings in the world. It evaluates MBA programs according to the following criteria:

  • Quality of teaching and research - academic reputation and scientific activity
  • Graduate career prospects - employment and career growth
  • International reputation - global recognition
  • Graduate earnings - financial results after training
  • Entrepreneurial activity - creation of own business

Key achievements

The published QS Global MBA ranking highlights the program's strengths:

  • High scores in entrepreneurship criteria - support for startups and innovations
  • Excellent graduate career prospects - 95% employment within 3 months
  • International recognition of education quality - compliance with world standards
  • Strong research base - scientific publications and research

"Entering the top 50 best business schools in Asia confirms that we create world-class education available in Central Asia."

Comparison with world leaders

By entrepreneurship and graduate employability indicators, our MBA program also ranks in the top 50 best in the world. By this indicator, Narxoz University Business School scored high points and outperformed other world-renowned schools such as:

  • Carnegie Mellon (USA) - leading technological university
  • Dartmouth (USA) - one of the oldest business schools in America
  • Shanghai University of Finance and Economics (China) - leader in financial education
  • Tsinghua (China) - prestigious Asian university
  • Edinburgh (UK) - historical university with strong business school
  • Manchester (UK) - well-known management school

Regional leadership

This achievement confirms that we create education that meets and exceeds world standards. Our MBA program became the first in the Central Asian region to achieve such high results in international rankings.

Development prospects

This success motivates us to continue developing and improving the quality of education. We plan to:

  • Expand international partnerships - cooperation with leading universities in the world
  • Improve research activities - increase in scientific publications and projects
  • Develop entrepreneurial programs - support for startups and innovations
  • Strengthen career support for students - employment and mentoring programs
news.author: Narxoz Business School Press Service

news.title: A new Executive MBA program focused on digital transformation has been launched
news.description: Narxoz Business School presented an updated Executive MBA program, which includes modules on artificial intelligence and digital technologies.
news.fullContent:
Narxoz Business School presented an updated Executive MBA program, which includes modules on artificial intelligence and digital technologies. The program was developed in collaboration with leading technology companies and includes practical projects.

New program modules

The updated Executive MBA program includes the following innovative modules:

Digital business transformation

The module is dedicated to digital transformation strategies and includes:

  • Analysis of organizational digital maturity
  • Development of digital strategy
  • Change management in the digital era
  • Digital business models

Artificial intelligence in business

Practical application of AI in various industries:

  • Machine learning for business analytics
  • Business process automation
  • AI in marketing and sales
  • Ethical aspects of AI use

Digital finance and FinTech

Study of modern financial technologies:

  • Blockchain and cryptocurrencies
  • Digital payment systems
  • FinTech regulation
  • Investment in digital assets

Practical projects

The program includes real projects with partner companies:

  • Consulting projects for real companies
  • Development of digital solutions
  • Analysis of cases from leading technology companies
  • International internships

Partnerships

The program was developed in collaboration with:

  • Microsoft Kazakhstan
  • Google for Startups
  • Local technology companies
  • International consulting firms

Learning format

The Executive MBA program maintains a convenient modular format:

  • 12 months of study
  • Modules of 3-4 days each month
  • Online support between modules
  • Individual consultations
news.author: Academic Director of Narxoz Business School

news.title: MBA students participated in an international hackathon in Singapore
news.description: The Narxoz Business School team took second place at an international hackathon on sustainable development, organized by partner universities.
news.fullContent:
The Narxoz Business School team took second place at an international hackathon on sustainable development, organized by partner universities. Our students presented an innovative solution for environmental problems in the region.

About the hackathon

The International Sustainable Development Hackathon was held in Singapore with teams from 15 countries. The event was organized by leading universities in Asia and Europe to find innovative solutions to global environmental problems.

Hackathon theme

This year's hackathon was dedicated to the theme "Sustainable Cities of the Future" and included the following areas:

  • Energy efficiency and renewable energy sources
  • Smart transportation systems
  • Waste recycling and circular economy
  • Green building
  • Digital solutions for ecology

Our project

The Narxoz Business School team presented the "EcoSmart Central Asia" project - a comprehensive solution for monitoring and managing environmental indicators in Central Asian cities.

Key project features

  • IoT sensors for air quality monitoring
  • AI algorithms for predicting environmental risks
  • Mobile app for citizens
  • Dashboard for city authorities
  • Integration with existing city systems

Team composition

Our team was represented by:

  • Alisa Kim - MBA, project manager
  • Damir Nurlanov - MBA, technical director
  • Maria Petrova - MBA, data analyst
  • Artem Sokolov - MBA, marketer

Competition

Teams from the following participated in the hackathon:

  • National University of Singapore
  • Hong Kong University of Science and Technology
  • Tokyo University
  • London School of Economics
  • Stanford University
  • And other leading universities

Results

Our team took second place, losing only to the Singapore team. The jury highly appreciated:

  • Innovativeness of the solution
  • Practical applicability
  • Presentation quality
  • Technical implementation

Development prospects

After the hackathon, the project received support from:

  • Asian Development Bank
  • Local environmental organizations
  • City administrations

The team plans to launch a pilot project in Almaty next year.
news.author: International Department of Narxoz Business School

news.title: A new corporate center for Executive Education programs has been opened
news.description: A modern corporate center with innovative auditoriums and spaces for teamwork has opened on the Narxoz campus.
news.fullContent:
A modern corporate center with innovative auditoriums and spaces for teamwork has opened on the Narxoz campus. The center is equipped with the latest technologies and creates an ideal environment for executive education.

New opportunities

The 2000 square meter corporate center includes:

Innovative auditoriums

  • Transformable auditorium for 100 people
  • Seminar rooms for 20-30 people
  • Meeting rooms for team work
  • Co-working area for informal communication

Technological equipment

  • Interactive boards and projectors
  • Video conferencing systems
  • VR equipment for simulations
  • High-speed internet
  • Voting and polling systems

Design and comfort

The center is designed taking into account modern requirements for educational spaces:

  • Ergonomic furniture
  • Natural lighting
  • Ventilation and air conditioning systems
  • Green areas and rest areas

Cafe and recreation areas

For comfortable stay of program participants:

  • Modern cafe with healthy food
  • Lounge areas for informal communication
  • Terrace with city view
  • Fitness room for active recreation

Center programs

The new center will host:

  • Executive MBA programs
  • Corporate trainings
  • International conferences
  • Networking events
  • Coaching sessions

Partnership programs

The center will also be used for programs with our international partners:

  • ESMT Berlin
  • Penn State University
  • University of Monaco
  • Other leading universities

Sustainability

The center was built taking into account sustainable development principles:

  • Energy efficient systems
  • Use of environmental materials
  • Waste recycling systems
  • Green technologies
news.author: Infrastructure Department of Narxoz Business School

news.title: Narxoz Business School received international AACSB accreditation
news.description: Narxoz Business School became the first in Central Asia to receive prestigious AACSB International accreditation.
news.fullContent:
Narxoz Business School became the first in Central Asia to receive prestigious AACSB International accreditation. This confirms that our programs meet world standards of education quality.

About AACSB accreditation

AACSB International is one of the most prestigious accreditation organizations in world business education. Obtaining this accreditation means compliance with the highest quality standards.

Accreditation criteria

  • Quality of teaching and research
  • Relevance of educational programs
  • International cooperation
  • Graduate career prospects

Value for students

AACSB accreditation opens new opportunities for our students and graduates.
news.author: Narxoz Business School Press Service

faculty.name: Yelzhas Aubakirov

Partner of UN Women in Kazakhstan and Central Asia, with over 20 years of experience in teaching and mediation practice. Worked in managerial positions, including leadership roles.

faculty.name: Liliya Bisengali

faculty.name: Zevira Toleutaeva

faculty.name: Kaisar Makan
faculty.description: MBA, Certified Business Trainer, Facilitator, Professional International Coach Erickson International Coach ICF. Over 15 years of experience in corporate training and leadership development. Specializes in developing leadership competencies and teamwork.

faculty.name: Marina Novotochina
faculty.description: Executive coach, business trainer, HR consultant, Doctor of Business Administration (DBA). Over 25 years of experience in HR management and organizational development. Specializes in leadership development, change management, and organizational development.

faculty.name: Aleksandr Chmel
faculty.description: Author and lead instructor of courses on finance and corporate governance, as well as professional development programs and leadership potential development for managers of major Russian and international companies. Taught at Moscow School of Management 'Skolkovo', Academy of Association of Independent Directors, GSBA MSU named after M.V. Lomonosov. Expert in corporate finance, strategic management, and leadership development.

faculty.name: Marat Atnashev
faculty.description: Ambassador of the Academic Environment at Narxoz Business School. CEO MSM SKOLKOVO (2016-2019). Associate at Harvard University, Davis Center for Russian and Eurasian Studies. Expert in academic development and international education. Specializes in strategic development of business schools and academic programs.

faculty.name: Andrei Levchenko
faculty.description: Expert, business practitioner, specialist in implementing changes and improving the effectiveness of people and processes. Over 20 years of experience in consulting and change management. Worked with major Russian and international companies. Specializes in organizational development, change management, and operational efficiency improvement.

faculty.name: Nikolai Verkhovsky
faculty.description: Developer and lead of corporate programs, business games, strategic and project sessions. Consultant on strategy, project and innovation management, and corporate transformations. Over 15 years of experience in strategic consulting and corporate training. Specializes in strategic planning, innovation management, and organizational transformations.

faculty.name: Maksim Kiselev
faculty.description: Doctor of Social Psychology from Yale University. Top manager and expert in business and corporate education, business development, corporate relations management, reputation, external and intra-organizational communications, organizational behavior, leadership, and management psychology. Over 25 years of experience in academic and corporate environments.

faculty.name: Bulat Mukushev
faculty.description: Chairman of the Board of Directors of NAO 'Narxoz University'. PhD, MBA HSE 'Higher School of Economics', MBA Yale University, USA (2003). Holds a CFA certificate. Area of academic interests: alternative investments, investment analysis, and business valuation. Expert in corporate governance and strategic development.

faculty.name: Farhad Manteev

Specializes in change management for over 8 years, participated in major transformation programs for transition to target business model, process automation, corporate culture change, ERP system implementation, other IT and digital solutions in Kazakh and international companies: 'Samruk-Kazyna', 'Kazakhstan Temir Zholy', BDO.

faculty.name: Akzharkyn Knykova

reviews.text: The program helped update knowledge, look at work from a new perspective and emphasized the importance of supporting young employees so that their ideas do not remain unrealized.
reviews.author: Aset Sadybekov
reviews.position: Director of ForteBank branch in Astana

reviews.text: It was important for me that the company invests in my development — this motivates. Learning became a challenge and growth, requiring combining study and work.
reviews.author: Svetlana Shashkova
reviews.position: Director of ForteBank branch in Uralsk

reviews.text: In a rapidly changing world, learning is the key to success. It helps to adapt, develop management skills, find opportunities, maintain leadership and grow personally.
reviews.author: Saltanat Nauryzbayeva
reviews.position: Director of ForteBank branch in Semey

reviews.text: Learning opened new opportunities and became a course of rethinking work. Each module was accompanied by analysis of the branch in Ekibastuz and competitors.
reviews.author: Ainur Kenzhebekova
reviews.position: Director of ForteBank branch in Ekibastuz

reviews.text: I always develop, implemented projects with BIG 4. Participation in the pilot program Narxoz — a year of meetings with branch directors, case discussions and experience exchange, which strengthened connections and improved work efficiency.
reviews.author: Anna Pilipenko
reviews.position: Board Member, Managing Director (Chief Risk Officer)

reviews.text: In 2023, I enrolled in Executive MBA for ForteBank managers at Narxoz. The program in strategic management, finance and marketing developed management skills and provided knowledge in financial analysis and project evaluation.
reviews.author: Azat Gabdullin
reviews.position: Director of Almaty Regional Branch in Kaskelen

reviews.text: I am studying EMBA at Narxoz and am satisfied with the structure, schedule and level of teachers. Some of them we consider as trainers for the company. Thank you for quality and practical training.

reviews.position: Acting Director of HR Management at RG Gold LLP

reviews.text: The Executive MBA program at Narxoz gave me new tools for management and strategic planning. Practical cases and experience exchange with colleagues are especially valuable.
reviews.author: Elena Kim

hero.title: MBA
hero.subtitle: (Master of Business Administration)
hero.description: Program #1 in Central Asia according to QS Global MBA 2025

mainContent.title: MBA Program (Master of Business Administration)
mainContent.paragraph1: This is the key to a successful business career. The MBA program at Narxoz Business School provides practical skills, real cases, professional connections and career growth. You will receive modern knowledge in business management, strategic planning and leadership.
mainContent.paragraph2: Our MBA program in Almaty is the optimal choice for specialists and managers striving to develop leadership qualities, professional networking and create an environment for joint solutions to modern business challenges.

weekendFormat.title: Weekend format
weekendFormat.description: Learning 3-4 days per month in modular format

groupSize.title: 30 people
groupSize.description: 30 people in a group from different regions of the country

experts.title: Experts
experts.description: Practicing teachers and internationally recognized diploma

feature1.title: Learning without leaving work
feature1.point1: Every month for three days you immerse yourself in one topic. This format allows you to concentrate on the subject
feature1.point2: The module ends with solving a case or completing an assignment

feature2.title: Peer to Peer education
feature2.point1: Learning from equal to equal. The main value of EMBA is that you can learn from others and help with your experience too
feature2.point2: Your group will include representatives from different industries and areas, which will expand your group experience several times

feature3.title: Practical Immersion
feature3.point1: Learning takes place on real cases, assignments and projects are related to your work
feature3.point2: Application of knowledge immediately in work is expected

skillsDevelopment.title: In the MBA program Narxoz Business School
skillsDevelopment.subtitle: managers develop

iq.title: IQ
iq.description: Next-level thinking. Tools and approaches for solving complex problems and creating competitive advantage

eq.title: EQ
eq.description: A leader who is trusted. Managing yourself and your team through understanding emotions and building strong connections

socialCapital.title: Social capital
socialCapital.description: Not just connections — capital. Expand your sphere of influence through strategic contacts and business alliances

metaSkills.title: Meta-skills
metaSkills.description: Seeing the whole, connecting different things and acting ahead — meta-skills that ensure leader effectiveness

requiredDisciplines.title: Required disciplines
disciplines: Modern sales and customer experience management
Digital transformation and technologies in business

electiveDisciplines.title: Elective disciplines
disciplines: Personal effectiveness and self-management of a manager
Systems thinking and solving complex problems

specializations.title: Specializations to choose from
specializations.subtitle: The program offers four specializations — choose the one that's closer to you.

strategicManagement.title: Strategic management
points: Business model management and innovation
Competitive position management and market strategies
Digital transformation of the company

digitalManagement.title: Digital management
points: Business process automation and artificial intelligence
Data-driven decision making with AI implementation
Artificial intelligence in business operations

finTech.title: Financial technologies (FinTech)
points: Basic concepts and applications of financial technologies
Fin-tech innovations in lending, insurance and capital management
Business planning and project evaluation

entrepreneurship.title: Entrepreneurship
points: Business planning and project evaluation
Innovation and creation of new products and services-idea testing
Growth strategies and business scaling challenges

zte.description: ZTE Global Technology Center has trained about 500,000 students worldwide over 20 years. On topics such as management and ICT, such as 5G, cloud computing, Internet of Things, etc.

hero.title: Executive MBA for CIO
hero.subtitle: Inspire your employees and create a powerful future for your company
hero.catalogInfo: IN THE CATALOG YOU WILL FIND ALL THE NECESSARY INFORMATION ABOUT THE PROGRAM

whatIsSection.title: What is
whatIsSection.description: This Executive MBA program is designed for top-level IT executives, technology strategists, and digital transformation leaders. It aims to develop leadership qualities, management skills, and digital competencies in accordance with key CIO competencies and the IAC Digital Model.

competenciesSection.title: The program was developed in partnership
competenciesSection.description: The International Academy of CIO (IAC) has developed a comprehensive set of key competencies for CIO, CDTO, CTO, CDO, combined into three main categories that form the foundation of the Executive MBA for CIO. The program focuses on developing leadership skills and digital transformation capabilities.

individualCompetencies.title: Individual competencies
items: Communication: effective oral and written skills
Systemic and design thinking: ability to understand and solve complex problems
Customer service and marketing: customer orientation and promotion of IT services
Interpersonal relationship management: skills in building and maintaining effective relationships

itDepartmentCompetencies.title: IT department competencies
items: Project and program management: control over the implementation of IT projects
Cybersecurity: ensuring the protection of information systems
IT policy and organization: development and implementation of IT policies
IT efficiency assessment: analysis and control of IT system and service performance
Procurement: effective acquisition of IT resources and services

businessOrganizationalCompetencies.title: Business-organizational competencies
items: Strategic aspects of IT and digital transformation: building a strategy in accordance with business goals
Innovation: development and management of technological innovations
Technology management: evaluation and implementation of new solutions
Investments and capital planning: budget management and IT investments
E-government: implementation of digital public services
Enterprise architecture: design and management of the organization's IT architecture

businessLeadership.title: Business and Leadership
businessLeadership.subtitle: (30 ECTS, 9 courses)
courses: Strategic leadership in the digital age
Digital ethics and corporate social responsibility (CSR)
Business efficiency metrics and IT strategy

technologyDigitalStrategy.title: Technology and Digital Strategy
technologyDigitalStrategy.subtitle: (25 ECTS, 8 courses)
courses: Cloud computing and IT infrastructure management
Enterprise architecture and IT portfolio management
IT management in the public sector and e-government

practiceFinalProjects.title: Practice and Final Projects
practiceFinalProjects.subtitle: (10 ECTS, 2 courses)
courses: CIO Leadership simulation and executive coaching
